intro: Stachystemon vermicularis, commonly known as the threadleaf stachyse, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact clusters called capitula. It is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Stachystemon vermicularis is often used in xerophytic gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
